questions.question: 1.If there exits the class Student, then what does the following programming statement imply? Student s[] = new Student[5];

answers.a: a.5 students objects instantiated with garbage value.
answers.b: b.5 student objects instantiated with default values.
answers.c: c.5 Student object references with null value.

questions.question: 2.Identify the valid statements about the 'this' operator:

answers.a: a.this is passed as parameter from non-static method to static method.
answers.b: b.this is passed as parameter from static method to non-static method.
answers.d: d.this helps in accessing local variables.

questions.question: 3.In object-oriented programming, an association relationship is a relationship between two classes that describes a connection or interaction between the objects represented by those classes. Which of the following statements is true about association relationships?

answers.a: a.An association relationship is always a one-to-one relationship.
answers.b: b.An association relationship is always a many-to-many relationship.
answers.c: c.An association relationship can be a one-to-one, one-to-many, or many-to-many relationship.
answers.d: d.An association relationship can only be a one-to-many relationship.
